I don't think it's always the explosions coming from lobby activity though sometimes that seems the case.

Oh this is a good one. Once I failed my final crate sourcing because (long story,) and on my final return, I jumped out of a Hydra and parachuted to the yellow corona only to miss it by two-seconds because i couldn't sprint to it while my character was taking off his parachute like a fucking runway model.

why, yes it is
Really? I always felt that if anyone even knows what a GTR is or care about any car and its performance, they know the GTR is beast.

I totally get what you're saying. I was a lot more fond of getting into skirmishes when i had a large crew to rely on and when my friends were in the same lobby more often.
Nowadays I might retaliate if someone picks a fight but not for long. It's just not as fun.
But to your point about playing fair, unless people are cheating with mods or wall breaches or whatever, I just can't get onboard with that sentiment. If it's a game function available to everyone, it cannot be called OP or unfair or unbalanced. By definition.
People used to say the Rhino was OP. I never understood why you didn't just get your own Rhino. How is that unbalanced? Just as an example.
And before you say the Hydra is OP, make a post about how the Hydra can't be beat and see how many people come out of the woodwork to say how easy it is to dodge a missile or to take out a Hydra using a Buzzard, etc.
It's all so subjective. And honestly, I think the game is so vast, there are so many things to do, changing lobbies is so easy, and there are so many tools at your disposal that I just don't get why people criticize the game all the time. (Not you, specifically. I get your frustration. I still stand by my assertion that the game is balanced as intended, working as intended and anything people dislike about it is just a preference.)
Some you can pass through and others are like walls. It's especially confusing because you can find both kinds a block from each other in midtown near Rockford Hills (near the central LSC)

I read your comment with an open mind but honestly pretty much everything you said is just your personal preference.
The level of ease you want it to be is subjective.
Some people might want a challenge in delivery. Others might want more ease in disruption! Who's to say which is more correct? The bottom line is this is how Rockstar WANTS people to interact and battle. If you don't want that level of conflict, that's not that the game is broken or unbalanced. That's really my whole point.
If this were a single player mode, there would be a difficulty slider. But it's multiplayer so you meet different types of player with different objectives and different skill levels. Just like you would in COD or any other multiplayer game.
I guess you admit you're wrong. Ok.
Just explain why you think it's OP.

Things should be nerfed if they're overpowered and cannot be beaten by anything else. It ruins the balance of the game.

You need to explain why you think it should be nerfed. All you did in your original post is say it should be nerfed with no explanation as to why.

No you didn't. First you said the Hydra needs to be nerfed. Then you said how the Hydra isn't as good as the Buzzard.
So why does the Hydra need to be nerfed?
Why?

Easiest way for PS4
PS4 menu setting setup network connection manual then choose all the default settings until you get to MTU change the MTU from the default 1500 to 900 or 800 and hit X default settings all the rest. No need to "test internet settings" unless you want to.
When you want to play with people again, come back to network settings and select "easy" which will reset everything to default.
Doing this with friends is also orders of magnitude easier than doing it solo. So count your blessings and congrats on your first sales.
Source: https://m.liveleak.com/ll_embed?f=074d937b32d1

WRITING.TEXT: And I will add that if your concerned with high performance, stick with the RH8 because it outperforms the Retro.
Look at the stickied mega thread and then ask any additional questions you might have.
Can a Hydra take down another Hydra?
Are you suggesting people play cooperatively and in teams?!! Here comes the downvote train
You're never going to get this sub to understand that this game is designed to create teamwork through conflict. Any post of this nature will be downvoted. Fact.

Are you saying that three people versus one troll in a Hydra, the three people will always lose no matter what they do?
Because if you think the team of three can win this battle, then you agree with the game design.
If you think the three will always lose no matter what, then you'll always think this game is unbalanced.

That's an interesting analogy. The problem is that the kind of balance you're describing isn't the building block for a game like GTAO while it might be for a game like Rock Paper Scissors.
You don't always answer someone else's weapon with a counter weapon. Sometimes you just answer with skill or strategy.
How many times in this sub have you heard complaints that level one noobs have access to a homing launcher and that's not fair toward air attacks? Then someone else says if you can strafe a homing missile, "git gud" etc.
This game designed this game mode to be difficult to do without the help of teammates. That's not imbalance. That's game design. If you work outside of those parameters, you should expect different results.
So many links! Don't know which to click. I guess I won't click any of them! \_()_/
Coke is buggy and there hasn't been a workaround or a fix yet. Roll the dice or stick to another business (like meth or counterfeit) until it you're confident enough to try again.

Everything you said is true so I won't dispute any of it. BUT all of it is tempered quite a bit when you have a team with you while delivering. And that's not only the point of my post but the point of the DLCs.
If you're gonna lone wolf it (and there's nothing wrong with that; I do it all the time. I'm not crapping on lone wolves) you have to know there are risks and those risks aren't the game being broken or unbalanced. It's the lone wolf choosing to be alone.

You do have a point about the timing of the ping. 3-seconds is not even enough time to get forward momentum in a Cuban.
While YMMV on this one, I've only seen one or two people really try to attack a delivery in any fairly-full lobby. And even that's rare. It's not normal to have an entire lobby coming after you. So 20% bonus on a ~$million shipment with one or two people coming after you WHILE you have a couple of buddies watching your flanks is pretty reasonable, to me.

I can see this being a tunable thing that would increase interaction. But the low-level people who are always the minions in the lobbies I see are probably very happy with $10,000 every 10-minutes or so. That's nothing to kick out of bed.
The really successful CEOs in this sub can chime in on this.

We'll just have to agree to disagree. Because to me, three of my buddies and I versus a couple of trolls on a delivery isn't only doable, but it's fun AND challenging. I think the challenge is the fun. And the times when I'm delivering solo in a crowded lobby just to risk the hostile bonus is nerve wracking and fun at the same time.
Like I said, it's working as intended. People might not like it but it's not broken.
I'm not fond of turn-based RPGs or flight sims, but I'm not going to say the flight sim needs to more lasers or the fantasy RPG needs a horror mode. (Although now that i say it, that last one sounds kind of cool haha)
I disagree. You're basically alleging that 3 v 1 is always a losing proposition.

WRITING.TITLE: Sucks that this has to be said. CEO work is not supposed to be a breeze.
WRITING.TEXT:
There's been a lot of talk about griefers and imbalance in the game. The griefer discussion has been going on since launch so I won't get into it too much here and will just say "let people play the way they want to play" and leave it at that. Unless players are cheating, trying to control how other play the game -- even as it relates to and affects you -- is not only futile, but it's hypocritical.
Regarding what people consider an imbalance in CEO, MC delivery work (because Hydras are OP or camping is a bitch move or whatever,) I can only say that the game design is working as intended.
The whole point of the last two DLCs is to get players to interact and play together in teams. Be it a motorcycle club or some executive criminal enterprise, the point is to have team members help you make deliveries and finish missions.
If you're playing solo, you risk getting your shit wrecked. I mean you risk that no matter what, but that's not broken game design. It's made that way to heighten risk/reward and to encourage player interaction.
There are many ways around having to deal with rival CEOs and other trolls; this sub is chock full of ways to circumvent loss and maximize gain. So if this is too rough for someone, there are ways out. But they need get it through their heads that it's *not supposed to be easy* and they think the game should change to suit them, they're gonna have a bad time.

Omg. Dude. Get friends. Gear up and deliver. That's the point of this whole DLC. You're supposed to be a CEO with associates and body guards.
If someone doesn't like the DLC working as it's intended, then they can just do something else. But it's not supposed to be easy. It's not broken. And it's not unbalanced.
Makes sense. I saw your other comments and picked up on the MO.
It's a joke. Obviously that guy is from the 1920s or somewhere in the Middle East.

"Tunables" refers to code that is installed on your system at the time of a large update. But it is released or "activated" only after prompted to do so from the server.
So the 2x payout algorithm, for example, gets activated and activated server side. Since the PlayStation 4 has a "sleep" feature that allows programs and games to continue running in a low-power mode (when you're done with the console for the night, for example,) these server-side prompts don't affect the game until you reboot.
So some of us still have the 2x running on our machines.
Sleep mode always works for PS4 tunables.

There's a way to bypass the cooldown (on PS4 at least, probably other platforms as well) by suspending the application by starting YouTube or Spotify or Netflix or whatever other app.
Then you go back to GTA and it puts you in a new session but the cooldown timer is gone.
Even with this glitch, however, there's no way you're sourcing and selling 10 cars in an hour.

There's no way you're sourcing and selling a car every 6-minutes. That's such a hyperbole. Even with the YouTube glitch you're looking at six deliveries an hour. Maybe seven if you're lucky and eight if you're really lucky. I'd love to see video proof of you sourcing and selling 10 cars in an hour. And then "topping it up" with VIP work for a $million an hour.
If you can do this, I'll personally nominate you as GTA CEO of the Year.

It depends on what "worth it" means to you.
I'll switch to MC work because it's more immersive and the missions are fun. (The delivery mission where the guy riding shotgun gets you high off his second hand smoke is hilarious.)
Money-wise it's hard to argue the time ROI doing CEO work.
But it becomes such a grind it's good to switch it up once in a while.
For the record, I have car warehouse; small, medium, and large special crate warehouses; coke lockup, meth lab, counterfeit business and weed farm
So is it worth it? Depends. I for one enjoy having it from a fun point of view as well as a collector's point of view, and it makes money too.
I don't know why my character won't close the Cargobob door when he steps out. It's so inconsiderate and rude.

You can get a call from your executive assistant saying you're being robbed. This is possible.
But you only get the call while you're a CEO and all this time I've only gotten that call once. It's RNG so your mileage may vary.
Even when you get the call, you have plenty of time to go and shoot some bad guys and get your crates back. Not sure what happens if you fail. Either way, it was actually kind of fun.
Other than that, there's no disadvantage to waiting.

I feel like GTA could totally justifiably charge real money for a single-player DLC and they'd make enough to pay for the new context 10x.
At this point, who wouldn't pay $3.99 for a brand new set of missions and continuing story for Michael, Franklin, and Trevor?

This is the go-to argument for more critics. "It takes too long to grind!"
Do you remember the early days, pre-moneypocalypse servers? That's the actual proper pace of this game. I played missions and sold Lampadati Felon until I got enough to buy a two-car garage under the overpass.
Then I played until I was able to buy a 6-car garage and apartment. And finally I got my first 10-car apartment (101 Weazel, still my vote for best penthouse location in the game!) and felt like I had really achieved something.
Around this time is when I reached level 100 or so. That's how it should be. Slow and steady. At least to me.
And that's the crux of this argument. How fast the grind should be is purely subjective. I, for one, didn't think players should be driving around in a chrome Adder at level 17. But that's just me.

Couple of things; you can shut down your business while there are some supplies in it, and it will just stay dormant with no calls from LJT.
You can customize your map icons by selecting "hide options" in your interactive menu. This should clean up your map quite a bit.
I hope this helps. But yes, I agree we should always have the option to sell things we've purchased. There's no reason from a game point of view that should prevent that.
No never moved. In fact, fave sovereign got assigned to me before I even bought a Clubhouse.

Unless you're hurting for the cash, what's the big deal about having properties you don't really use? Genuinely asking. Cuz at least if you just shut down and ignore, in the future if you get an itch to start it up again you'll have it.

This can't be right because it has been assigned three times. Once without me knowing it.
1) I logged on after a long hiatus from GTAO and when I hopped on my Sovereign he game assigned it as my favorite. I googled it and learned what it was and started riding my Bagger to get that to be my favorite.
2) eventually it worked and my Bagger was my favorite. Now I got a new bike that's way better and I want that to be my new favorite so I start riding my Gargoyle religiously
3) it doesn't change. But the other day I notice a street-stolen Ruffian was my favorite even though I never rode it. I collect these sometimes for the tequila-la mission as sticky bomb fodder. I've since blown that ruffian up and replaced its slot in my bike garage.
So three separate favorite assignments. And none that I'm happy with.
Additionally, google the topic. It's clear you're supposed to be able to change it but it's either broken or REEEeaally unclear what's supposed to happen.

When I finish Fleeca with a friend, chances are we get put into two different lobbies anyway and have to rejoin manually. And that's only one other player the computer has to think about. Not to mention the times I get put into a lobby without my friend and there are only three other people.
Give it some mj to calm its nerves.
Well when you say stupid things like "fuck this game" as if it's the game's fault you fail, this is the answer.

Some Pegasus ground vehicles like the Rhino spawn at a specific spawn location; some of which are Vespucci Beach by the pier (on the east side of the pier on the sand); the Vespucci police station's impound lot; across the street from the Manns Chinese Theatre or whatever its called in GTA; at the interior parking lot of the horse race track at the casino; near the Redwood Track Dirt track in Blaine County; at the construction site where the bulldozer spawns in Palermo Bay; and others.

Your controller is probably broken and giving input.
Is it GTAV or GTAO? Because single player doesn't time out.

Well the game is designed to be played with teammates. So if you're circumventing this by playing in a empty lobby, then that shit's on you.
I play in a solo-public all the time so I don't blame you for that. But the game mechanics are the way they are because they want you to play with people. So either figure it out (like destroy the NPCs before you start your delivery, as others have suggested) or just disconnect if you're failing and eat the loss of cargo; try again and hopefully you get a delivery mission that's easier.
But whatever you do, you can't really blame the game in this instance. If there was a bug or glitch or connection issue which is Rockstar's fault, sure. But this is just a mission that is working as intended. It's your own fault for failing.
The Gargoyle is my MC President's daily ride. (Still trying to get the favorite label to stick. Been riding it for almost 100,000 miles by now...)
